alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Burlington; Camden; Gloucester; Monmouth; Ocean; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 07 at 9:36PM EST until March 07 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM EST FOR NORTHERN ATLANTIC...EAST CENTRAL SALEM...OCEAN...CAMDEN...EASTERN GLOUCESTER...BURLINGTON AND SOUTHWESTERN MONMOUTH COUNTIES... At 936 PM EST, severe showers and embedded thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Allentown to Glassboro, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Cherry Hill, Jackson, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Voorhees, Medford, Barnegat, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Hammonton, Lumberton, Florence, Beachwood, Burlington, Mount Holly, Pitman, Clayton and Berlin. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 7A. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 31 and 58. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 46 and 92. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 21 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This line of heavy showers and embedded thunderstorms may contain little or no lightning. Do not wait until you hear thunder before taking cover.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Burlington; Camden; Gloucester; Monmouth; Ocean; Salem
